briefdescription.para: Default polarity: active high.
Default trigger mode: edge-triggered.
Returned from get_cpu_id_from_lapic_id if the CPUid passed in does not map to a logical CPU id.

Indicates the source of a PCI IRQ route.
Should contain "RSD PTR ".

Revision: 0 = ACPI 1.0, 2+ = ACPI 2.0+.

detaileddescription.para: Total length of the table, including this header.

briefdescription.para: 64-bit physical address of XSDT (ACPI 2.0+)
Checksum of entire RSDP (ACPI 2.0+)
Reserved bytes (must be zero)
OEM-defined table identifier.
OEM table revision.
Vendor ID of utility that created the table.
Version of utility that created the table.
Standard ACPI header.
Array of 32-bit physical addresses to other tables.
ACPI Root System Description Pointer (RSDP)

detaileddescription.para: Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: Detect SMP CPU cores and APICs (Local and IOAPIC).

detaileddescription.para: This function parses the MADT (APIC table) and sets up CPU topology and IOAPIC data.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the IOAPIC structure by index.

simplesect.para: ioapic_t structure containing details of the IOAPIC

briefdescription.para: Get the total number of IOAPICs detected in the system.
Translate a legacy IRQ number (0–15) into a GSI using overrides.

simplesect.para: Global System Interrupt (GSI) for the IRQ

briefdescription.para: Determine the interrupt polarity of a given IRQ.

simplesect.para: 0 for active high, 1 for active low

briefdescription.para: Determine the trigger mode of a given IRQ.

limine CPU info

briefdescription.para: ACPI detection and enumeration header. Provides low-level interfaces to extract CPU topology, IOAPIC mappings, and PCI IRQ routing from ACPI tables such as RSDP, XSDT, MADT, and others.
